results.title: School as a resource unit (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A case study of a resource-centred junior school. Children and staff of a British school are seen in normal school activities, many of which involve the use of multi-media material from the school resource centre.

results.title: School and community: getting into the act
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how communication between school councils and the school communities can benefit both bodies. Community education activities are shown which help to integrate the school and the outside community. Discusses the role of the school council in the provision of community education facilities and covers issues such as the composition of the council, evaluation of the council and the council as employer.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions

results.title: School's Out
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: School's out
results.creator_credit: Mervyn Scales, H Scales and Auster Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the activities of Australia’s 700,00 city children when their schools close for holidays. For some children, holidays mean a make-believe world of cowboys and six-shooters, hopscotch and football in the back streets. Other children make use of various facilities provided by the community, well equipped playground, swimming pools and junior clubs for yachting, life saving and hiking. The work of such organisations at the Police Boy’s Clubs, Sea Cadet Corps and National Fitness Camps is shown, providing for the healthy recreation of children when School’s out.

results.title: School's in, Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Russian Education”.
Examines the present school system in the Soviet Union. Demonstrates the style of Soviet teaching which is fairly rigid and formal, with the emphasis on teacher dominated instruction and passive pupils, responding only when instructed to do so. A more flexible teaching style was introduced some years ago but was later abandoned. Photographer, Dean Semler; script, Roger Milliss; editor, Martyn Down; sound, George Hart, Howard Spry; commentator, Margaret Throsby.

results.title: School
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
This video looks at school and school life in China. It is part of a television series on Chinese language and culture with an emphasis on communication. The video includes an interview with Chinese school students, a look at Chinese script (to study), the erhu (a Chinese stringed instrument), and short dramas in Chinese. The interview questions are repeated in Chinese script, Pin Yin and English.

results.title: School
results.creator_credit: Garry Dunstan, Pat Hunder and It's About Time
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
This anarchic series of comic sketches and songs expresses teenage views on school and teachers. School is seen as a meaningless prison where the students are given no space or time to explore and create.

results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
The introduction of major psychotic drugs have meant that many schizophrenics can now lead normal lives in the community. These drugs however, can have severe side effects, and sometimes they can only limit the disease. This program looks at some typical case studies in schizophrenia and seeks out opinions on the use of drugs and other methods of treatment of this most frightening illness.

results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Couchman hosts a studio discussion on schizophrenia among an audience of medical professionals, schizophrenics and others possessing a direct experience of the condition.
